passages.name: Best NEXT GEN console!?
passages.text: What's the best NEXT GEN console? I've been thinking of retiring my old Direct Box and upgrading to something else. Thanks!

passages.name: SnideCooper's Reply
passages.text: Tony Play Box. That's the best console if you say it isn't, you have worms for brains.

passages.name: Calm Reply GB1
passages.text: I respect SnideCooper's opinion, but I personally prefer the entertainment and value you get with the Funtendo Y!

passages.name: Angry Reply GB1
passages.text: Well, the original, maybe, but the newest model, Tony Play Box 3 has next to no games. Phaze and Knick 2 are not worth $599.99, let alone their own $60 price tag.

passages.name: Sarcastic Reply GB1
passages.text: I also like to pay $600 for a paper weight.

passages.name: Ignore GB1
passages.text: I think the Tony Game Box 3 and the Funtendo Y both have their merits! The Tony Game Box 3 has the potential for high definition gaming and media experiences that we just haven't seen before, but the Funtendo Y is bursting at the seams with creativity. I think it's worth grabbing either, OP, or even both consoles if you're working a second job, lol.

passages.name: SnideCooper's Reply GB1
passages.text: You're only saying that because you're a Funtendrone.

passages.name: Calm Reply GB2
passages.text: Haha, we prefer Funtendo Fans or Fantendos. Okay, no, that second one is pretty bad.

passages.name: Angry Reply GB2
passages.text: I'm only saying that because I like to play games that aren't shit.

passages.name: Sarcastic Reply GB2
passages.text: I'm the drone, yet you're the one producing an automated response.

passages.name: Waveracer2099's Email
passages.text: Hey, sorry about Snide Cooper. He's always like this. Sometimes he goes too far and we get a reprieve from him for a week after the mods drop the banhammer. He sent me this weird link, though. Have you seen anything like this?

passages.name: SnideCooper's Reply GB3
passages.text: Go play Superb Guys 1937 (Which hasn't even been good in years) and I will play my games which actually require an IQ to understand.

passages.name: Angry/Sarcastic Reply GB3
passages.text: Yeah, a low IQ.

passages.name: Calm Reply GB3
passages.text: Have you tried New Superb Guys Universe? It's genuinely really good and I think you might like it!

passages.name: SnideCooper's Reply GB4
passages.text: When was the last time they even made a new IP? 20 years ago?

passages.name: SnideCooper's Reply GB7
passages.text: Superb Guys wasn't even as good a Wack Wallaby.

passages.name: Calm Reply GB4
passages.text: Brain Bug and Funtendogs were HUGE on the Funtendo GS! Not to mention the slightly more obscure hits like Fire Heart Pep Squad and Father III.

passages.name: Angry Reply GB4
passages.text: I see you are COMPLETELY ignoring the Funtendo GS.

passages.name: Sarcastic Reply GB4
passages.text: You don't really need to make eight new IP's a month when you have actually good ones to begin with.

passages.name: SnideCooper's Reply GB5
passages.text: My little sister has one of those, it's literally for babies and grandmas

passages.name: Calm Reply GB5
passages.text: If your sister ever wants to play Superb Guys with me, my Friend Code is 5346 8050 4311!

passages.name: Angry/Sarcastic Reply GB5
passages.text: Surprised you're related to someone whose brain isn't cancer. Figured it was genetic.

passages.name: Ignore GB2
passages.text: (Upon ending your conversation with them, SnideCooper emails you, as your email is available as part of your public profile)

passages.name: SnideCooper's Email
passages.text: I can't believe you ran off from our conversation like a coward. Proof that you KNOW the Tony Game Box 3 is the superior game console. Go here if you want to experience a REAL console:

passages.name: Calm Reply GB7
passages.text: How is Wack Wallaby these days?

passages.name: Angry/Sarcastic Reply GB7
passages.text: Why don't you go wack your wallaby?

passages.name: Banned Message GB1
passages.text: You have been banned from this forum for two weeks for poor behavior.

passages.name: SnideCooper's Reply GB8
passages.text: Last year's remake was a best seller, DUMBASS!

passages.name: SnideCooper's Email Banned Alt
passages.text: I can't believe you got me banned! If it wasn't for your Funtendo whining, I wouldn't have lost my posting privileges. This is so stupid. I hope you got banned too. If you did, I guess you can keep posting here:

passages.name: Austrian PM Grilled
passages.text: This European leader's new sandwich that you can eat! When people think food, they don't usually think of Austria, but one Austrian leader is here to prove of us wrong. The sandwich, dubbed the Tafelspitz Brote by locals, is a boiled beef extravaganza that wants to invite you to its party. When asked about growing tensions between Austria and its neighboring countries, the PM had this to say, "You have not lived until you have had Tafelspitz from the homeland. I have made it far easier for the people to enjoy this delicacy with this sandwich!"Celebrity chef, Ricardo Geurbeau chimed in with his take on the Austrian leader's new edible delight, "I think it's an outrage that this man continues to ignore the growing tensions in the political landscape. Last month's UN commissary meeting should have shown him just how pressing these issues are, yet here we see him ignore them once again. The silk trade embargo has been crushing Austria's economy and nothing has been done."If you'd like to make the PM's Tafelspitz Brote at home, click the link below!

passages.name: Celebrity Power Couple Calls it Quits
passages.text: It's Hollywood heartbreak for Jinko, the fan-coined term for the relationship between movie star, Laura Jini, and extreme sports skater, Kole Ferguson. Announced at a national press conference in Belarus, the two have decided to split up over creative and romantic differences. They had been in the European country filming 20th Century Fox's new Point Break sequel, Point Breakup. Some believe that this split is actually research for the upcoming film.During the press conference's Q&A session, Kole Ferguson said the new film would be "Tight." while Laura Jini refused to comment on the status of the reportedly troubled production. More on this story as it develops...

links.label: Celebrity Power Couple Calls it Quits Comments

passages.name: Tafelspitz Brote Recipe
passages.text: For Tafelspitz:4 lb. roast 2 lb. beef marrow bones3 large carrots3 moderately sized turnips1 celery stalk1 large red onion2 bayleaves10 peppercorns5 juniper berriesDash of salt1/4 cup chives8 oz. sour cream4 tbsp. fresh horseradish1 cup whipping creamFor Brote:42g fresh yeast (42g),2 tbsp. salt2 tbsp. sugar760ml buttermilk1 lb. flour200g soy seedsChop all tafelspitz ingredients and place in a large saucer.Boil for 2 hours and let sit.Dissolve brote ingredients together and mix. Fill into pan and bake for 1 hour.Open the baked brote once cooled and place tafelspitz in accordingly.

passages.name: The Latest Space Force Movie SUCKED
passages.text: Lucas George has clearly lost it at this point. I grew up with the original three Space Force movies, like all true fans did, and I can't believe he's spat on the legacy of those movies.>Queen Azalea gets bored and dies>Skyhopper kills his best friend Jars cause evil>45 minutes watching a filibuster>need to read three books to understand opening crawl>only explains half the mysteries>effects not as good as Ring Lords>$6 a ticket

passages.name: Calm Reply SF1
passages.text: I think what all of us fans need to accept is that these new movies are for a younger generation. I'm pretty sure lots of kids enjoy them!

passages.name: Angry Reply SF1
passages.text: Wow, you call yourself a "true fan", but there are SO MANY mistakes in your post. First off, Queen Azalea's death represented the death of The Federal Democracy. It's basic symbolism. The same goes for Jars, that's Skyhopper turning his back to his past and become Dark Vande (Which you've misspelled in your username because of course you have).And I'm sorry, but if you didn't get the filibuster scene, then you just lack basic cinematic literacy. Guess there weren't enough explosions in that part for you (Only the one at the end). That whole portion of the movie is the key to the ENTIRE saga, including the originals!

passages.name: Sarcastic Reply SF1
passages.text: I also like to spend my free time whining about children's movies.

passages.name: DarkVandee SF1
passages.text: The original movies weren't for kids. They were sophisticated epics for adults.

passages.name: Calm Reply SF2
passages.text: It's okay to like stuff for kids! I'm a big Funtendo fan, and I'm glad they still make their stuff with kids in mind.

passages.name: Angry Reply SF2
passages.text: I like them, but they're baby movies for babies.

passages.name: Sarcastic Reply SF2
passages.text: Same-tier of sprawling epic as the sagas of Care Hares and My Miniature Equine.

passages.name: DarkVandee SF3
passages.text: How can Queen Azalea even die if her daughter Countess Paella says they formed the New Militia together? Someone should've gotten fired for that blunder.

passages.text: "Space Force is a film for 12 year olds." - Lucas George Link:

passages.name: Lucas George Tells All
passages.text: In Anaheim, CA, the year's largest gathering of geeks, nerds, and fans of a good time at the movies took place. Space Force Fest 5 brought together this collection of enthusiasts to celebrate the latest release in the Space Force series. We sat down to speak with the one and only, Lucas George, creator of the Space Force Saga.Home Scape: Thanks for taking time out of your busy schedule to sit with us, Luke. Can we call you Luke?Lucas George: You shouldn't.Home Scape: Alright, Luke! First question, what do you have to say to fans who think these new Space Force movies aren't as good as the originals?Lucas George: I think they can be safely ignored.Home Scape: Ignored? Your most loyal fans?Lucas George: Space Force is a film for 12 year olds. Those are my most loyal fans, not sweaty 30-year olds whose only bathing soap is an unopened bottle of Jars Bath Bubbles.Home Scape: Some people would say that the most recent films are too political for children. What do you have to say to that?Lucas George: I think politics have been too childish for adults.Home Scape: Before you go, can I ask you about the rumored sequel trilogy to the original Space Force trilogy? Any plans on making those?Lucas George: Why would I tell you that?Home Scape: Thanks, Luke!

passages.name: Remember that moon game?
passages.text: Do y'all remember that game where you have, like, a week to stop the moon from falling? That game was freaky.

passages.name: How do you beat Grab Grappler in Gonzo: Year of the Blade?
passages.text: I'm stuck trying to beat this large crab monster, and having serious trouble. Any tips?

passages.name: Gonzo P2
passages.text: You know how crabs sidestep? Try that.

passages.name: Gonzo P3
passages.text: Have you tried consulting a history book? I heard everything in that game is historically accurate.

passages.name: Gonzo P4
passages.text: Thanks, sidestepping worked!

passages.name: Moon Game P2
passages.text: It was even less than a week! That game had me sooooo stressed. I would always fail on day three and just gave up eventually.

passages.name: Moon Game P3
passages.text: You know you can travel back in time to the first day at anytime right, DoubleMintGum?

passages.name: Moon Game P4
passages.text: My mind is blown.

passages.name: Moon Game P5
passages.text: That game was super deep. You know it was about grief and loss and stuff?

passages.name: Moon Game P6
passages.text: Mind double blown!

passages.name: Lunar Eclipse Tonight
passages.text: Get your telescopes out because tonight is a once in a lifetime skygazing opportunity! Look to the sky this evening and you'll see a blood red gleam coming from everyone's favorite lunar construct. The moon will be totally eclipsing the sun tonight. Scientists believe there's nothing to worry about regarding tonight's occurence, so feel free to look as you please!
